document_title: Sore eyes: Causes, symptoms and common diseases
subsection_content:
Patients with eye pain when examined at the Ophthalmology Department will be diagnosed by the doctor using the following methods [6]:
Check symptoms: evaluate the patient's overall condition to find the cause, including: how long ago the eye pain first started, accompanying symptoms, migraine, fever, chills, runny nose...; Check medical history: to know if the patient has factors that cause eye pain, collisions, injuries, sinusitis, autoimmune diseases, migraines...
Eye examination: measuring visual acuity, visual field, checking pupil size, direct and consensual reflexes, examining structures around the eye, examining eyes with a slit lamp, ophthalmoscopy, measuring intraocular pressure...
After receiving the eye examination results, the doctor will diagnose the cause of eye pain and choose the appropriate treatment method for the patient.
Feeling of a lump or foreign body, light sensitivity related to diseases of the eyelids, conjunctiva or corneal surface.; Pain on the eye surface with photophobia, foreign body, pain when blinking, high possibility of corneal damage, foreign body in the eye or corneal erosion.; Pain deep in the eye socket, throbbing like a knife, often related to glaucoma, uveitis, scleritis, endophthalmitis, and orbital inflammation.
